alert.note: Alert for Eagle; Garfield; Moffat; Rio Blanco; Routt (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 28 at 9:31AM MST until February 28 at 10:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Eagle County in west central Colorado... Routt County in northwestern Colorado... Northeastern Garfield County in west central Colorado... Southeastern Moffat County in northwestern Colorado... Northeastern Rio Blanco County in northwestern Colorado... * Until 1000 AM MST. * At 930 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 14 miles south of Battle Creek Campground to New Castle, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 101 and 149. Colorado 131 between mile markers 35 and 68. Locations impacted include... Steamboat Springs, Hayden, Oak Creek, Yampa, Mt Zirkel, Clark, Milner, Tow Creek, Hahns Peak, Phippsburg and Sweetwater. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED

area.areaDesc: Eagle; Garfield; Moffat; Rio Blanco; Routt
